Status.description:
The property Status is of type "string" and an example is ""ACAD"".
It indicates the the relative position or standing of things or especially persons in a society.

Headteacher.description:
The property Headteacher is of type "string" and an example is ""Emme Ford"".
It indicates the the educator who has executive authority for a school.

Telephone.description:
The property Telephone is of type "string" and an example is ""01422 246610"".
It indicates the electronic equipment that converts sound into electrical signals that can be transmitted over distances and then converts received signals back into sounds.

Executive_headteacher.description:
The property Executive_headteacher is of type "string" and an example is """".
It indicates the Executive (a person responsible for the administration of a business) headteacher (the educator who has executive authority for a school).

Website.description:
The property Website is of type "string" and an example is ""http://www.abbeyparkacademy.org"".
It indicates the a computer connected to the internet that maintains a series of web pages on the World Wide Web.

School_Name.description:
The property School_Name is of type "string" and an example is ""Abbey Park Academy"".
It indicates the School (an educational institution) Name.

School_Wards.description:
The property School_Wards is of type "string" and an example is ""Illingworth and Mixenden"".
It indicates the School (establishment where a seat of higher learning is housed, including administrative and living quarters as well as facilities for research and teaching) Wards (block forming a division of a hospital (or a suite of rooms) shared by patients who need a similar kind of care).

NOR.description: The property NOR is of type "integer" and an example is "210".

Previous_DFE_Code.description:
The property Previous_DFE_Code is of type "string" and an example is """".
It indicates the Previous (previous is an open source emulator of the proprietary 68k-based NeXT computer system family, aiming at emulating the original 68030-based NeXT Computer and the 68040-based NeXTstation and NeXTcube computers.) DFE Code (a set of rules or principles or laws (especially written ones)).

Post_Code.description:
The property Post_Code is of type "string" and an example is ""HX2 9DG"".
It indicates the Post (the position where someone (as a guard or sentry) stands or is assigned to stand) Code ((computer science) the symbolic arrangement of data or instructions in a computer program or the set of such instructions).

Type.description:
The property Type is of type "string" and an example is ""P"".
It indicates the a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

DFE_Code.description:
The property DFE_Code is of type "integer" and an example is "2005".
It indicates the DFE Code (a set of rules or principles or laws (especially written ones)).

Address_1.description:
The property Address_1 is of type "string" and an example is ""Keighley Close"".
It indicates the Address (the place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with) 1.

Address_2.description:
The property Address_2 is of type "string" and an example is ""Illingworth"".
It indicates the Address (the place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with) 2.

Address_3.description:
The property Address_3 is of type "string" and an example is ""HALIFAX"".
It indicates the Address (the place where a person or organization can be found or communicated with) 3.

Fax.description:
The property Fax is of type "string" and an example is ""01422 246612"".
It indicates the duplicator that transmits the copy by wire or radio.

get.description: Find "schools_list" by Headteacher. This API method can be used to find "schools_list" data by Headteacher, and you must filter the results by a specific Headteacher. These results will contain the following fields: Status, Headteacher, Telephone, Executive_headteacher, Website, School_Name, School_Wards, NOR, Previous_DFE_Code, Post_Code, Type, DFE_Code, Address_1, Address_2, Address_3, Fax. An example of using this method is "http://localhost:8080/Headteacher/Emme Ford" or "http://localhost:8080/?Headteacher=Emme Ford", whose result would include at least the following record: { "Status" : "ACAD", "Headteacher" : "Emme Ford", "Telephone" : "01422 246610", "Executive_headteacher" : "", "Website" : "http://www.abbeyparkacademy.org", "School_Name" : "Abbey Park Academy", "School_Wards" : "Illingworth and Mixenden", "NOR" : 210, "Previous_DFE_Code" : "", "Post_Code" : "HX2 9DG", "Type" : "P", "DFE_Code" : 2005, "Address_1" : "Keighley Close", "Address_2" : "Illingworth", "Address_3" : "HALIFAX", "Fax" : "01422 246612" }

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The parameter "limit" is of type "integer".
This parameter is not required and must be in "query".
It indicates the  limit (the greatest possible degree of something).

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description:
The parameter "offset" is of type "integer".
This parameter is not required and must be in "query".
It indicates the  offset (cause (printed matter) to transfer or smear onto another surface).

parameters.name: visualisation
parameters.description:
The parameter "visualisation" is of type "string".
This parameter is not required and must be in "query".
It indicates the  visualisation (a mental image that is similar to a visual perception).

parameters.name: Headteacher
parameters.description:
The parameter "Headteacher" is of type "string".
This parameter is required and  must be in "path".
It indicates the  Headteacher (the educator who has executive authority for a school).

get.description: Find "schools_list" by Address_1. This API method can be used to find "schools_list" data by Address_1, and you must filter the results by a specific Address_1. An example of using this method is "http://localhost:8080/Address_1/Keighley Close" or "http://localhost:8080/?Address_1=Keighley Close", whose result would include at least the following record: { "Status" : "ACAD", "Headteacher" : "Emme Ford", "Telephone" : "01422 246610", "Executive_headteacher" : "", "Website" : "http://www.abbeyparkacademy.org", "School_Name" : "Abbey Park Academy", "School_Wards" : "Illingworth and Mixenden", "NOR" : 210, "Previous_DFE_Code" : "", "Post_Code" : "HX2 9DG", "Type" : "P", "DFE_Code" : 2005, "Address_1" : "Keighley Close", "Address_2" : "Illingworth", "Address_3" : "HALIFAX", "Fax" : "01422 246612" }

get.description: Find all "schools_list". This API method can be used to find all "schools_list", and you can filter the results by Status, Headteacher, Telephone, Executive_headteacher, Website, School_Name, School_Wards, NOR, Previous_DFE_Code, Post_Code, Type, DFE_Code, Address_1, Address_2, Address_3, Fax. These results will contain the following fields: Status, Headteacher, Telephone, Executive_headteacher, Website, School_Name, School_Wards, NOR, Previous_DFE_Code, Post_Code, Type, DFE_Code, Address_1, Address_2, Address_3, Fax. An example of using this method is "http://localhost:8080/", whose result would include all the records until the limit. Furthermore, the results can be filtered as mentioned before using the following pattern "/?field1=value1&field2=value2&...". An example of this type of filtering is: "http://localhost:8080/?Status=ACAD" It is possible to specify the "limit" and the "offset" parameters in order to paginate the results, or "visualisation" to show information in charts.

info.description: This API returns data about the "schools_list", being able to filter by different characteristics, for example: Status, Headteacher, Telephone, Executive_headteacher, Website, School_Name, School_Wards, NOR, Previous_DFE_Code, Post_Code, Type, DFE_Code, Address_1, Address_2, Address_3, Fax. The API response will be in JSON format, containing a list of objects with properties: Status, Headteacher, Telephone, Executive_headteacher, Website, School_Name, School_Wards, NOR, Previous_DFE_Code, Post_Code, Type, DFE_Code, Address_1, Address_2, Address_3, Fax. In addition, the following parameters can always be used: visualisation, which is used to show the information graphically; limit, which serves to limit the maximum number of results to show (default 10000); and offset, to indicate from which number to return from the results set, very useful for pagination results. An example of a query would be the following: http://localhost:8080/Status/"ACAD"
info.title: schools_list
